round_best: Develop a hybrid AI model that integrates a vision-language model (VLM) with sensory feedback data for adaptive failure detection in robotic manipulation. The VLM would interpret visual and textual environmental data to predict potential manipulation outcomes, while embedded sensors in the robot's manipulators collect real-time tactile, force, and torque data. This multimodal approach allows the robot to dynamically adjust its strategy based on predictive discrepancies and actual sensory feedback, enhancing its ability to recognize and learn from failures in diverse real-world tasks.
